awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  EW: Champion Air Tracker (CAT)
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project is significant. On the commercial front, this project introduces a disruptive technology in motion tracking. The technology can benefit a broad customer base, including gaming, VR/AR and smart appliances. On the societal front, the motion tracking technology enables new ways of controlling virtually everything around us, which can lead to new ways of education, telepresence, health care, and scientific experiments. Moreover, the novel algorithms developed in the project significantly advance the state-of-art in localization and motion tracking technology. Through its internship program, the project provides exciting hands-on research experience opportunities for students and teaches them how to transfer research into products. Such experience will train them as leaders in future research & development roles.
  
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project develops accurate motion tracking and gesture recognition systems using acoustic signals to offer four distinct advantages: (i) high tracking accuracy; (ii) low-cost and easy deployment without the need for additional hardware; (iii) easy to use; and (iv) the ability to function under a wide range of scenarios. The technology can potentially revolutionize gaming, VR/AR, and the smart appliance industry, and opens the door to new applications. In addition to designing accurate motion tracking systems, the project will create a software development kit (SDK) and several significant applications that take advantage of the accurate tracking capability.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project has developed a highly accurate motion tracking and gesture recognition system utilizing acoustic signals. This disruptive technology has the potential to revolutionize the motion tracking industry by offering several unique advantages, such as high tracking accuracy, cost-effectiveness, and ease of deployment without requiring additional hardware. Our system leverages existing speakers and microphones found in smartphones, smart speakers, and televisions to track devices and users. To encourage widespread adoption of our technology, we have designed a user-friendly software development kit (SDK) for companies and developers. Furthermore, we have created several innovative applications that capitalize on our accurate tracking capabilities, including controlling motion-based gaming, virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), televisions, and Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

The broader impact and commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project has been significant. Our motion tracking technology has been applied to control a wide range of devices in our surroundings. We have showcased our systems at various venues, such as CES and SXSW, and have won numerous startup awards. Additionally, we have collaborated with several companies to develop prototypes incorporating our motion tracking technology. Beyond this, we have provided training to researchers and engineers in the development of motion tracking systems and applications, further contributing to the growth of this emerging field.


Last Modified: 09/10/2023
Modified by: Yichao Chen
